intro: Pasania obovalifolia, commonly known as the oval-leaf pasania, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its oval-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along riverbanks. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural studies.
